block.p: An guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Westchester and Putnam Counties this week. Items for the guide may be submitted by mail, at least three weeks in advance, to Westchester Cultural Calendar, North Salem, N.Y. 10560.
Theater
CROTON FALLS -- ''Abundance'' by Beth Henley. Today at 4 p.m. Tickets: $17. The Schoolhouse, Owens Road. (914) 277-8477.

An guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Westchester and Putnam Counties this week. Items for the guide may be submitted by mail, at least three weeks in advance, to Westchester Cultural Calendar, North Salem, N.Y. 10560.
Theater
CROTON FALLS -- ''Abundance'' by Beth Henley. Today at 4 p.m. Tickets: $17. The Schoolhouse, Owens Road. (914) 277-8477.

ELMSFORD -- The musical ''Grease.'' Wednesdays through Saturdays at 8 p.m., with dinner at 6 and Sundays at 7 p.m., with dinner at 5. Matinees: Wednesdays and Thursdays at 1 p.m., with lunch at 11:30 a.m. and Sundays at 1:30 p.m., with lunch at noon. Through June 24. Tickets: $46 to $66, with discounts at selected performances for students, older people and children. Westchester Broadway Theater, 1 Broadway Plaza. (914) 592-2222.

KATONAH -- Axial Theater presents three one-act plays: ''Tina Hits the Troposphere'' by Bill D'Agostino; ''Beyond Easton'' by Emily Masciandaro and ''Persephone Rising'' by Howard Meyer. Tonight at 7. Tickets: $10. The Barnspace, 113 Todd Road. (914) 232-2034.

MONTROSE -- Hand-to-Mouth Players perform ''Painting Churches'' by Tina Howe. Today at 2 p.m. and Thursday through next Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $10; students and people 62 and older, $8; Thursday evening only, $5. Theater of Veterans Affairs Hospital, Route 9A. (914) 762-6685.
Music and Dance

BRONXVILLE -- ''Carmen'' by New Rochelle Opera Company, directed by Camille Coppola. Sponsored by Eastchester Arts Council. Today at 2:30 p.m. Tickets: $10; people 62 and older, $8; students, free. Bronxville Women's Club, 135 Midland Avenue. (914) 793-6946.

BRONXVILLE -- Robin Murphy, mezzo soprano sings Rossini, Brahms, Strauss, Rachmaninoff and Ives songs; accompanied by April Kuhr, pianist. Today at 3 p.m. Free. West Center Congregational Church, 101 Pondfield Road West, at Chatfield Road. (914) 337-3829.

DOBBS FERRY -- Angelica, a group of female chamber singers sing music by American composers, including Aaron Copland, Randall Thompson, Jean Berger, Jerome Kern and Stephen Foster. Today at 3 p.m. Tickets: $8; older people and children, $5. South Presbyterian Church, 343 Broadway. (914) 478-4083.
ELMSFORD -- Johnny Maestro and the Brooklyn Bridge, with guest comic, Ed Ryan. Tuesday at 8 p.m., with dinner at 6. Tickets: $55. Westchester Broadway Theater. (914) 592-2222.

KATONAH -- Traditional and contemporary music performed by Jim Skinger Jazz Quartet. Today at 4 p.m. Tickets: $12; students and older people, $8. St. Luke's Episcopal Church, Bedford Road. (914) 232-9200.

MOUNT VERNON -- Famous lieder duets and romantic solos for piano. Presented by Carol Goodfriend, soprano; Beth Samuels, mezzo soprano; and Natasha Ulyanovsky, pianist. Today at 3:30 p.m. Tickets: $10; older people, $5. Wartburg Church, Wartburg Adult Care Community, Wartburg Place and East Lincoln Avenue. (914) 699-0800.

NYACK -- The musical ''Mame,'' starring Carol Lawrence. Previews: next Saturday 8 p.m., next Sunday 2 p.m., June 20 at 7 p.m., June 21 at 2 and 8 p.m. and June 22 at 8 p.m. Tickets: $20. Show opens June 23. Through July 9. Tickets: $25 to $42.50. Helen Hayes Performing Arts Center, 117 Main Street. (845) 358-6333.

NEW ROCHELLE -- Mozart's ''Requiem,'' performed by Sound Shore Chorale; Norman Brooks, music director, along with his former students: Pamela Sklar, flutist; Adam Kent, pianist; Eric Katz, percussionist; Arthur Giglio, baritone; and Karina Calabro, soprano. Today 4 p.m. Tickets: $15; students and older people, $12. Christ United Methodist Church, 1200 North Avenue. (914) 636-1583.

SOUTH SALEM -- Westchester Girls Choir, presenting selections from Randall Thompson's ''Frostian,'' Bizet's ''Carmen'' and other classical and popular music; David Graf, music director Today at 4 p.m. Free. South Salem Presbyterian Church. (914) 472-6652.
YONKERS -- Bob Arthurs Jazz Quintet. Today at noon. Free. Bronx River Parkway Reservation, Scarsdale Road. (914) 242-7275.
YONKERS -- Deirdre Donovan sings music of Rogers and Hart, Cole Porter, Jerome Kern and George Gershwin. Today at 2:30 p.m. Free. Will Library, 1500 Central Park Avenue. (914) 337-1500.

YONKERS -- Cantor David Shiff millennium concert, with the Long Island Cantors Ensemble. Program of Yiddish, Israeli, Hasidic and Sephardic melodies. Tonight at 7. Tickets: $25. Midchester Jewish Center, 236 Grandview Boulevard. (914) 779-3660.
Art
BRIARCLIFF MANOR -- ''In the Garden,'' recent acrylics by Diane Kline. Opens next Saturday. Through July 29. Images Art Gallery, 1157 Pleasantville Road. (914) 762-3000.

CHAPPAQUA -- ''From the Garden,'' floral-inspired work by Zelda Appleton, Cornelia Cotton, Consuelo Kanaga, George Kelly and others. ''Dialogues in the Garden: Figures in Cement,'' sculpture by Jo-Ann Brody. Opening reception for both exhibits, Friday from 4 to 7 p.m. Chappaqua Library, 195 South Greeley Avenue. (914) 238-4779.

CROTON-ON-HUDSON -- ''Flora and Fauna: Zelda Appleton's Photographs and Margaret Robinson's Watercolors.'' Opening reception Friday from 5 to 8 p.m. Through Aug. 12. Cornelia Cotton Gallery, 111 Grand Street. (914) 734-1292.
DOBBS FERRY -- ''Experiments in Sculpture'' by gallery members. Opening reception today from 2 to 5 p.m. Through June. Upstream Gallery, 26B Main Street. (914) 674-8548.
DOBBS FERRY -- ''Travels and Inspirations,'' landscapes and still lifes by Angela Stratton. Through June. Forever Gallery, 60 Cedar Street. (914) 674-8035.

ELMSFORD -- Drawings, paintings and collages by Evelyn Klein and her daughter Ellen Cohen. Through June. Reception Friday at 7 to 9 p.m. Greenburgh Town Hall, Tarrytown Road and Hartsdale Avenue. (914) 422-1038.
HASTINGS-ON-HUDSON -- ''Collection of Art Celebrating Our Native American Heritage.'' Through August. Arctic Artistry, 2 Spring Street. (914) 478-7179.

NORTH SALEM -- ''Unbottled: New York's Water -- Conservation + Preservation + Inspiration,'' exhibition exploring contemporary landscape issues in art and science in the county. Including water purity, animal protection, wetlands and history of the Croton Reservoir System presented through a ''talking map.'' Wednesdays through Saturdays from noon to 4 p.m. Through July 22. Admission: $4; older people, $3; children, free. (Lunch available by reservation. (914) 669-6777.) Hammond Museum and Japanese Stroll Garden, top of Deveau Road, off June Road. (914) 669-5033.

PEEKSKILL -- Walking tour of downtown artist district, with trips led by Wendie Garber to artists' residences, studio spaces and art galleries. Next Saturday from 10 a.m. to noon. Cost: $5. Meet in front of Paramount Center, 1008 Brown Street. (914) 734-1894.

PEEKSKILL -- ''Entourage,'' character portrait collages by Nancy Faulds. Also sculpture by Jo-Ann Brody, paintings by George Dubinsky and Christina Rae and works by other artists. Through July 29. Reception next Saturday from 3 to 5 p.m. Gallerie Jjenth, 1006 Brown Street. (914) 528-8664.
PURCHASE -- Alumni art exhibit with works by 34 alumni. Through June 19. Library of Manhattanville College. (914) 694-2200.
Lectures

CROTON-ON-HUDSON -- ''Enuf Is Enuf . . . Enough'' or ''Spelling Made Simple,'' phonics discussion by Ed Rondthaler. Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. Free. Croton Free Library, 171 Cleveland Drive. (914) 271-6612.

EASTCHESTER -- Allergies and natural healing by Dr. Leonard Caprio. Presented by Huxley Institute for Biosocial Research. Tomorrow at 7:30 p.m. Admission: $3. Eastchester United Presbyterian Church, Lincoln Place and Woodlot Avenue. (914) 337-2252.

HASTINGS-ON-HUDSON -- Bob Mankoff, cartoon editor of The New Yorker and founder of the Cartoon Bank. Presented at yearly meeting of Friends of Hastings Library. Today at 4 p.m. Free. Hastings Public Library, Maple Avenue. (914) 478-5584.

NEW ROCHELLE -- ''Healthy and Independent in Your Own Home,'' lecture for older people by Sharon Niman of Elderserve. Wednesday from noon to 1 p.m. Free. Jewish Community Center of Mid-Westchester, 999 Wilmot Road. (914) 472-3300, ext. 423.
WHITE PLAINS -- ''Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder,'' discussed by Jane Levitan. Wednesday at 6 p.m. Free. Center building of New York Presbyterian Hospital-Westchester Division. (914) 997-5779.
Films
PEEKSKILL -- ''Kadosh,'' Hebrew film with subtitles. Thursday and Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $9. Paramount Center, 1008 Brown Street. (914) 739-2333.

WHITE PLAINS -- ''Orphans of the Storm,'' silent film starring Dorothy and Lillian Gish. Tomorrow at 2 (followed by discussion) and at 6:30 p.m. ''To Kill a Mockingbird,'' with interviews of the actors and filmmakers. Wednesday at 2 and 6:30 p.m. Free. White Plains Public Library, 100 Martine Avenue. (914) 422-1480.
Children

BEDFORD -- Bob Lamont exhibits and talks about the fossils he has collected over 50 years, in a program for all ages. Today at 2 p.m. Free. Westmoreland Sanctuary, 260 Chestnut Ridge Road. (914) 666-8448.

CHAPPAQUA -- ''50 Ways to Fool Your . . . Father,'' concert featuring children's songwriter, Bill Harley. For families with children 6 through 12. Next Saturday at 4 p.m. Free. Chappaqua Library, 195 South Greeley Avenue. (914) 238-4779.
CROTON-ON-HUDSON -- Mime show for all ages by Robert Rivest, former student of Marcel Marceau. Friday at 7 p.m. Free. Croton Free Library, 171 Cleveland Drive. (914) 271-6612.
ELMSFORD -- ''Charlotte's Web,'' musical presented by Westco Productions. Next Saturday at 11 a.m. and 1 and 3 p.m. Tickets: $12. Westchester Broadway Theater, 1 Broadway Plaza. (914) 592-2222.

GREENBURGH -- ''Springfair'' with a ''meet the bees'' program; Polynesian, country, line and square dancing, nature family scavenger hunt, petting zoo, tractor rides, sale of plants, kits, refreshments and other items. Today from noon to 4:30 p.m. Rain or shine. Admission: $4; members, $2. ''Nature Bugs,'' program for children 3 and 4 and accompanying adult. Tomorrow from 1:30 to 2:30 p.m. Cost: $4; children, $3; members, $2 less. ''Critters, Crafts and Kids,'' program of walks, live animals and stories for children 18 months through 4 years. Cost: $4; children, $3; members, $2 less. Registration not required for either program. Greenburgh Nature Center, Dromore Road. (914) 723-3470.

MONTROSE -- Storytelling for adults and school-age children by Phyllis Stephens, with musical accompaniment. Next Saturday at 7 to 8 p.m. Free. Hendrick Hudson Library, 185 Kings Ferry Road. (914) 739-5654.

NEW ROCHELLE -- Instrumental workshop for children 7 through 13, featuring piano, violin, trumpet, guitar, clarinet, flute and drums. Presented by Westchester Chamber Orchestra. Friday from 4 to 5:30 p.m. Members of Songcatchers and Westchester Chamber Orchestra perform Charles Griffin's ''Peanut Butter and Jelly.'' Friday at 8 p.m. Free. St. Gabriel's High School, 50 Washington Avenue. (914) 654-1178.

NORTH SALEM -- Championship rodeo. Sponsored by North Salem Free Library and Croton Falls Fire Department. Today at 1 p.m. Tickets: $12; children, $9. Old Salem Farm, Route 124, June Road. (914) 669-5161.

OSSINING -- Children 6 and 7 view the aerial acrobatics of dragonflies and make a colorful dragonfly to keep. Today from 1 to 3 p.m. ''Constellations,'' children 10 through 12 gaze skyward to learn about stars, the stories of the constellations and engage in a game to further their understanding of the night sky. Next Saturday from 9 to 10:30 p.m. Bring flashlights. ''Animal Picnic,'' children 4 and 5 learn how animals get their food and where they eat it. Bring bag lunch for picnicking. Next Saturday from 11 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. Cost: $8 each; members, $6. Registration. Meet at nature center of Teatown Lake Reservation, 1600 Spring Valley Road. (914) 762-2912.

PURCHASE -- ''Heavy Metal,'' arts festival (not to be confused with heavy metal music concert). Family members view the exhibit ''Welded! Sculpture of the 20th Century,'' make take-home sculpture using recycled objects, create musical instruments from tossed-out materials and listen to steel drum music by the Nu-Lite Band. Today from noon to 4 p.m. Admission: $5; museum members, $3; children 2 and younger, free. Neuberger Museum of Art, Purchase College. (914) 251-6100.

SOMERS -- Learn how soap is made from goat's milk, while visiting the resident cows, horses, sheep, pigs and other animals. Today from noon to 3 p.m. Free. Picnicking welcome. Muscoot Farm, Route 100. (914) 232-7118.

WHITE PLAINS -- English and Spanish rhymes, songs and finger plays. For children from birth through 24 months. Next Saturday at 11 a.m. Free. White Plains Public Library, 100 Martine Avenue. (914) 422-4276.

YONKERS -- ''Look, Mom, I Ate My Science Experiment!'' Steve Ruff cooks up some incredible edibles. Today at 1:30 p.m. $1 and museum admission, additional $4; people 62 and older and children, $3. ''Juneteenth Celebration,'' Westchester Library System joins the library in a family event with music, stories, dance, arts, crafts, games, planetarium shows and author presentations. Next Saturday from noon to 4:30 p.m. Current sky shows: ''Sky Tonight,'' for children 8 and older and adults. Today and next Sunday at 1:30 p.m. ''Rusty Rocket's Last Blast,'' for children 6 and older and accompanying adults. Today and next Sunday at 2:30 p.m. ''Daughter of the Stars,'' American Indian sky stories for children 6 and older and adults. Today at 3:30 p.m. ''Start of It All,'' for children 10 and older and adults. Next Sunday at 3:30 p.m. Admission: $4 each; people 62 and children, $3. ''Sky Tonight.'' Fridays at 7 p.m. Pick up free tickets at front desk beginning at 6:30 p.m. Hudson River Museum, 511 Warburton Avenue. (914) 963-4550.
Potpourri
BEDFORD -- Learn which plants are well suited to attract wildlife. Next Saturday at 2 p.m. Free. Westmoreland Sanctuary, 260 Chestnut Ridge Road. (914) 666-8448.
CROSS RIVER -- ''In Search of Lady Slippers,'' three-mile wildflower walk. Today at 2 p.m. Ward Pound Ridge Reservation, off Route 35. (914) 763-3993.

CROTON-ON-HUDSON -- Clearwater's Great Hudson River Revival. Next Saturday and Sunday from 10 a.m. to dusk. Tickets: $30 a day; both days, $40; students, older people and the disabled, $20 a day. parking, $5. Croton Point Park. (914) 454-7673.
DOBBS FERRY -- Attic sale with country store and lunch. Next Saturday from 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. South Presbyterian Church, 343 Broadway.

GARRISON -- Community spring fair with music, dance, crafts, games and refreshments. Next Saturday from 3 to 6 p.m. (Rain date, next Sunday.) Admission: $10; children, $5; all family members, $20. Grounds of Desmond and Fish Library, Routes 403 and 9D. (845) 424-3020.
GARRISON -- Laurel hike. Next Saturday at 10 a.m. Manitoga, Route 9D, two miles south of Route 403. (845) 424-3812.

HARTSDALE -- American Kennel Club dog agility show, with information on adopting purebred dogs. Sponsored by Canine Sports Services, Port Chester Obedience Training Club and Nutmeg Portuguese Water Dog Club. Next Saturday and Sunday from 9 to 3 p.m. Ridge Road Park. (914) 452-4453.
KATONAH -- Al fresco lunch and tour of gardens. Tuesdays at noon. Through Aug. 15. Tickets: $25. Caramoor, Girdle Ridge Road. (914) 232-1253.

MONTROSE -- Phyllis Stephens demonstrates methods of coaxing family memories into a story format. Sponsored by Croton/Cortlandt Center for the Arts. Next Saturday from 2 to 4 p.m. Free. Registration. Hendrick Hudson Library, 185 Kings Ferry Road. (914) 739-5654.

MOUNT VERNON -- Church bell tower tour. Tuesday at 3:30 p.m. Visiting the graves of soldiers who fought in the Spanish-American War of 1898. Thursday at 3:30 p.m. Free. St. Paul's Church National Historic Site, 897 South Columbus Avenue. (914) 667-4116.

NEW ROCHELLE -- Time-saving, easy, low-fat Chinese cooking demonstration with Norma Chang. Program especially for older people, but open to all ages. Friday at 1 p.m. Free. New Rochelle Public Library, Library Plaza. (914) 632-7878.
OSSINING -- Book sale. Tuesday through Thursday from 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. and Wednesday evening from 5 to 8 p.m. Ossining Public Library, 53 Croton Avenue. (914) 941-2416.

PURCHASE -- ''Parents: Managing Many Lives,'' symposium beginning with yoga and an interactive health exhibit. Followed by workshops with topics including child care, workplace options, aging parents and surviving teenage adolescence. Thursday from 4:30 to 9:30 p.m. Tickets: $25, including light dinner and child care. Reservations. Reid Castle of Manhattanville College. (914) 366-7898.

RIVERDALE -- Adult drawing workshop, with artist, Ann deVere, teaching the art of the quick-sketch. Bring your own markers; all other materials provided. Today and next Sunday from 11 a.m. to 1 p.m. ''Sunset Wednesday,'' with tai chi instruction from 6 to 7:30 p.m., information on container gardening from 6:15 to 7:30 p.m. and koto music by Masayo Ishigure from 6:30 to dusk. Cooking demonstration of sancocho, a tropical vegetable stew by Dominican cook, Nilva Peets. Next Saturday at 2 p.m. Family art project, with participants coloring a poppy-full design with special crayons, then transferring it onto cloth to make a fabric picture for Father's Day or bringing a T-shirt to transform. Next Saturday and Sunday from 1 to 4 p.m. Meet artist, Dave Knox, whose photos of Australia and the Outback are on view through Aug. 27. Next Sunday from 2 to 4 p.m. All free with grounds admission: $4; students and older people, $2. Wave Hill, West 249th Street and Independence Avenue. (718) 549-3200.
RYE -- Bird walk. Next Saturday at 7:30 a.m. Read Sanctuary. (914) 967-8720.

SLEEPY HOLLOW -- Tours of Kykuit, the home to four generations of the Rockefeller family. Tours include a visit to the mansion, coach barn and the remarkable gardens, featuring glorious fountains and extraordinary 20th-century sculpture from the collection of Gov. Nelson A. Rockefeller. Daily, except Tuesdays with flexible tour times. Admission: $20; people 60 and older, $19; children 18 and younger, $17. Reservations only for groups of 10 or more. Tours begin at Philipsburg Manor visitors center, Route 9. (914) 631-9491.

WESTCHESTER -- County pools and beaches open for the season on a full-time schedule. Daily from 10 a.m. to 6 p.m., beginning next Saturday. (With the exception of Croton Point Park Beach. Open weekends and holidays only.) (914) 242-7275.
YONKERS -- Visit to Dragonfly Pond. Next Saturday at 2 p.m. Free. Lenoir Preserve. (914) 968-5851.
16 Sculptors in a Juried Exhibition
SIXTEEN sculptors from three Hudson Valley foundries are represented at a juried exhibition at the Howland Cultural Center in Beacon.

Michael Pilon of Tallix Foundry in Beacon was awarded first prize in the competition for his steel sculpture titled ''Uku''; second prize went to Anne Huibregtse of Argos Art Foundry in Brewster for ''Milk Train,'' a bronze work. Honorable mentions went to Thom Joyce of Argos for ''This World-This Circus,'' created from found welded steel, and to John Maffucci from Tallix for an untitled stoneware piece. Polich Art Works, a foundry in Rock Tavern, in Orange County, is also represented in the show, which runs through July 2.
At right is another sculpture by Mr. Joyce that is part of the show, ''Nuclear Flower II,'' a work in bronze.

The Howland Cultural Center, at 477 Main Street in Beacon, is open from 1 to 5 p.m. on Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays as well as by appointment. The numbers to call for information are (914) 831-4988 or (914) 831-4614.
